questions.prompt: Choose the correct form: She ___ already ___ the email before lunch.
questions.explanation: Past Perfect uses had + V3: had sent. The action was completed before another past moment.

questions.prompt: Fill in: They ___ to the office early. (go)
questions.explanation: Past Perfect requires had + V3. The past participle of go is gone.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct form: I ___ never ___ sushi before that trip.
questions.explanation: A past experience before another past event takes Past Perfect: had tried.

questions.prompt: Past Perfect uses did + V3.
questions.explanation: Past Perfect uses had + V3, not did.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "He had went home before it started."

choices.text: He had gone home before it started.
He went home before it started.
He had go home before it started.

questions.explanation: Past Perfect needs V3; the correct form is had gone.

questions.prompt: Fill in: She ___ the keys on the table. (leave)
questions.explanation: Past Perfect is had + V3, and the past participle of leave is left.

questions.prompt: Which sentence is correct?

choices.text: We had finished the test by 3 pm.
We had finish the test by 3 pm.
We has finished the test by 3 pm.
We finished had the test by 3 pm.

questions.explanation: Correct Past Perfect is had + V3: had finished.

questions.prompt: Past Perfect form is the same for all subjects.
questions.explanation: Had is used for all persons: I/you/he/we/they had + V3.

questions.prompt: Fill in: By 2010, he ___ three companies. (start)
questions.explanation: A completed action before a past time uses Past Perfect: had started.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct form: The movie ___ already ___ when we arrived.
questions.explanation: We need had + V3 for an earlier past action: had already started.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "We had not see her before."

choices.text: We had not seen her before.
We did not see her before.
We had not saw her before.

questions.explanation: Past Perfect requires V3: seen.

questions.prompt: Fill in: I was late because I ___ my alarm. (forget)
questions.explanation: The earlier action is in Past Perfect: had forgotten.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct form: When I arrived, the meeting ___.
questions.explanation: The meeting started earlier than the arrival, so Past Perfect is needed.

questions.prompt: In "She left after she had called him", Past Perfect shows the earlier action.
questions.explanation: Calling happened before leaving, so Past Perfect marks the earlier event.

questions.prompt: Fill in: By the time we got to the station, the bus ___. (leave)
questions.explanation: The bus left earlier than our arrival, so use Past Perfect.

questions.prompt: Which sentence correctly shows the earlier action?

choices.text: He apologized because he had broken the vase.
He apologized because he broke the vase.
He had apologized because he broke the vase.
He was apologizing because he had broke the vase.

questions.explanation: Breaking the vase happened before the apology, so Past Perfect is correct.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "After we had ate, we went for a walk."

choices.text: After we had eaten, we went for a walk.
After we ate, we went for a walk.
After we had eat, we went for a walk.

questions.explanation: Past Perfect needs V3: eaten.

questions.prompt: Fill in: She realized she ___ the wrong number. (dial)
questions.explanation: The dialing happened before the realization, so use Past Perfect.

questions.prompt: Choose the best option: I didn't recognize him because I ___ him before.
questions.explanation: Not meeting him is earlier than not recognizing him, so Past Perfect fits.

questions.prompt: Past Perfect is always used for both actions in a past sequence.
questions.explanation: Usually only the earlier action needs Past Perfect; the later one is Past Simple.

questions.prompt: Fill in: When the police arrived, the thief ___. (escape)
questions.explanation: The escape happened before the arrival, so use Past Perfect.

questions.prompt: Select the sentence that keeps the correct order.

choices.text: By the time she called, I had left.
By the time she called, I left.
By the time she called, I have left.
By the time she called, I was left.

questions.explanation: The leaving happened earlier, so Past Perfect is required.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "He was tired because he had work all day."

choices.text: He was tired because he had worked all day.
He was tired because he worked all day.
He was tired because he had working all day.

questions.explanation: Past Perfect needs V3: had worked.

questions.prompt: Fill in: They were surprised because they ___ the news earlier. (hear)
questions.explanation: The hearing happened before the surprise, so Past Perfect is used.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: By the time the show started, we ___ our seats.
questions.explanation: By the time signals an earlier completed action, so Past Perfect fits.

questions.prompt: Fill in: She had ___ finished when the bell rang. (only a moment before)
questions.explanation: Just shows a very recent completion before another past event.

questions.prompt: Markers like "already" and "by the time" often signal Past Perfect.
questions.explanation: These markers often show that one action finished before a past point.

questions.prompt: Choose: After he ___ the email, he called me.
questions.explanation: After can introduce the earlier action with Past Perfect: had sent.

questions.prompt: Fill in: She ___ sushi before that trip. (try)
questions.explanation: Past Perfect with never shows the earlier lack of experience.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "By the time I arrived, they have already left."

choices.text: By the time I arrived, they had already left.
By the time I arrived, they already left.
By the time I arrived, they had already leave.

questions.explanation: The time point is in the past, so we use Past Perfect: had left.

questions.prompt: Choose: I called him after I ___ the report.
questions.explanation: The report was finished before the call, so Past Perfect is appropriate.

questions.prompt: Fill in: He felt calm because he ___ the exam already. (pass)
questions.explanation: Already indicates completion before another past moment.

questions.prompt: With "before", Past Perfect is never possible.
questions.explanation: Past Perfect can be used with before to stress earlier completion.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: She smiled because she ___ the joke already.
questions.explanation: The understanding happened before the smile, so Past Perfect is used.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "We arrived after the movie had start already."

choices.text: We arrived after the movie had already started.
We arrived after the movie started already.
We arrived after the movie had already start.

questions.explanation: Past Perfect needs V3: started.

questions.prompt: Fill in: By 8 p.m., they ___ dinner. (finish)
questions.explanation: By + past time usually calls for Past Perfect for the earlier action.

questions.prompt: Fill in: I went back because I ___ my keys inside. (leave)
questions.explanation: Leaving the keys happened before going back, so Past Perfect is needed.

questions.prompt: If the order is clear from "after", Past Simple can be enough.
questions.explanation: Past Simple can work when sequence is obvious, though Past Perfect adds emphasis.

questions.prompt: Which sentence emphasizes earlier completion?

choices.text: She had cleaned the room before guests arrived.
She cleaned the room before guests arrived.
She was cleaning the room before guests arrived.
She has cleaned the room before guests arrived.

questions.explanation: Past Perfect highlights that cleaning was completed before arrival.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "He said he has finished the project."

choices.text: He said he had finished the project.
He said he finished the project.
He said he had finish the project.

questions.explanation: In reported past context, the earlier action takes Past Perfect: had finished.

questions.prompt: Fill in: I realized I ___ the wrong file. (open)
questions.explanation: Opening happened before the realization, so use Past Perfect.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct form: When we got there, the store ___.
questions.explanation: The store closed earlier than we got there, so Past Perfect fits.

questions.prompt: Past Perfect is required in every past narrative sentence.
questions.explanation: Past Perfect is only needed to mark earlier events; most narrative uses Past Simple.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "She was upset because she lost her passport earlier."

choices.text: She was upset because she had lost her passport earlier.
She was upset because she lost her passport earlier.
She was upset because she had lose her passport earlier.

questions.explanation: The loss happened before the upset reaction, so Past Perfect is clearer.

questions.prompt: Fill in: He apologized because he ___ me the wrong information. (give)
questions.explanation: Giving the wrong info happened earlier, so use Past Perfect.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: I didn't know the answer because I ___ the lesson.
questions.explanation: Missing the lesson happened before not knowing the answer, so Past Perfect is used.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "After I had finished, I had went home."

choices.text: After I had finished, I went home.
After I had finished, I had gone home.
After I finished, I had went home.

questions.explanation: Only the earlier action takes Past Perfect; the later action is Past Simple.

questions.prompt: Fill in: She was nervous because she ___ never ___ in public. (speak)
questions.explanation: The earlier lack of experience uses Past Perfect: had never spoken.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct question: ___ you ___ the report before the meeting?
questions.explanation: Past Perfect questions use Had + subject + V3.

questions.prompt: Fill in: He ___ not ___ the contract before he signed it. (read)
questions.explanation: Negative Past Perfect uses had not + V3.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "Did he had seen her before?"
questions.explanation: Past Perfect questions use Had + subject + V3; no did.

questions.prompt: In Past Perfect questions we use "had" for all persons.
questions.explanation: Had does not change with the subject in Past Perfect.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct negative: They ___ arrived when I called.
questions.explanation: Negative Past Perfect is hadn't + V3 (hadn't arrived).

questions.prompt: Fill in: Had you ___ the keys before you left? (find)
questions.explanation: Past Perfect question uses had + V3: found.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "She hadn't went to the office before."

choices.text: She hadn't gone to the office before.
She didn't go to the office before.
She hadn't go to the office before.

questions.explanation: Past Perfect needs V3: gone.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: I wondered why she ___ me earlier.
questions.explanation: The earlier lack of a call is in Past Perfect: hadn't called.

questions.prompt: Fill in: We ___ never ___ such a view before. (see)
questions.explanation: Past Perfect with never uses had + V3: had never seen.

questions.prompt: For negative Past Perfect we use hadn't + V2.
questions.explanation: Negative Past Perfect uses hadn't + V3, not V2.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct question: ___ they ever ___ the museum before the renovation?
questions.explanation: Past Perfect questions use Had + subject + V3.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "Had you finished? No, I haven't."

choices.text: Had you finished? No, I hadn't.
Did you finish? No, I hadn't.
Had you finished? No, I didn't.

questions.explanation: The short negative answer to a Past Perfect question is hadn't.

questions.prompt: Choose the best option: She moved to Berlin in 2018. She ___ German for years before that.
questions.explanation: Past Perfect shows the earlier background action: had studied.

questions.prompt: Past Perfect often introduces background events in stories.
questions.explanation: It marks earlier events compared to the main past timeline.

questions.prompt: Fill in: He told me he ___ the job the year before. (get)
questions.explanation: The getting happened earlier than the telling, so Past Perfect is used.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct form: The movie started. I ___ my seat already.
questions.explanation: Finding the seat happened earlier than the movie start, so Past Perfect fits.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "She said she has met him once before."

choices.text: She said she had met him once before.
She said she met him once before.
She said she had meet him once before.

questions.explanation: In past reporting, the earlier event uses Past Perfect: had met.

questions.prompt: Fill in: By the time we spoke, he ___ the decision. (make)
questions.explanation: The decision happened before we spoke, so use Past Perfect.

questions.prompt: In biographies, Past Perfect can show actions completed before a key year.
questions.explanation: It highlights earlier background events before the main past timeline.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: I remembered that I ___ my passport at home.
questions.explanation: Leaving the passport happened before the remembering, so Past Perfect fits.

questions.prompt: Find the mistake and choose the corrected sentence: "They were excited because they had win the prize earlier."

choices.text: They were excited because they had won the prize earlier.
They were excited because they won the prize earlier.
They were excited because they had winning the prize earlier.

questions.explanation: Past Perfect needs V3: won.

questions.prompt: Fill in: She joined the company in 2020, after she ___ from university. (graduate)
questions.explanation: Graduating happened before joining, so Past Perfect is used.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct form: The lights went out. We realized we ___ the bill.
questions.explanation: Not paying happened before the lights went out, so Past Perfect fits.

questions.prompt: Past Perfect is used to talk about a future plan.
questions.explanation: Past Perfect only relates to past events and their order.
